item.title: Turtlebot
item.description:
This project was done in pairs in the context of a class of Autonomous Robotics. We built SLAM-aided task planning software for ROS. The software was written in a mix of C++ and Python and ran on Kinect-enabled Turtlebots. We implemented:

  • Object detection from laser data
  • Object collision avoidance
  • Face tracking
  • Infrared-aided auto-docking
  • Landmark recognition
  • Visual localization
  • WiFi signal localization
  • Mapping
  • Occupancy mapping
  • Task planning

At the end of the project, the robot was able to carry-out a list of predefined tasks, namely undocking from its base, scouting around a building, mapping Wi-Fi hotspot locations, coming back to its starting point, and autodocking.
